title: Vanco Payment Solutions Appoints New EVP of Product & IT
text:
Sandra Blair joins the Vanco executive management team, as the company expands its product and service offerings to faith-based, nonprofit, and professional services organizations.
Atlanta, GA
Vanco Payment Solutions announced today that experienced business and technology executive Sandra Blair has joined the company to lead Vanco’s product development and IT. Blair is the former Head of Payments Practices for Alvarez & Marsal.
“Sandra’s strategic knowledge of payments and innovative payment products will expand our ability to provide faith-based, nonprofit, and professional services clients with additional options to support their mission and business goals,” said Vanco CEO Kevin Lee.
Blair is the most recent hire to the company’s senior management team . “We have been building our team over the past year with tremendous talent in marketing, operations, human resources and finance. The response has been overwhelmingly positive from our partners and clients. We've also seen significant growth in 2015,” said Lee.
Previously, Blair notably was Head of Product Development and Delivery at Vital Processing (now TSYS), and held director and executive positions in IT and product development at Align FSC and CitiStreet. She has more than 25 years’ experience building and leading teams focused on technology and innovation. Blair earned a Bachelor of Science in Finance and Commerce from Villanova University and lives in the Atlanta area.
About Vanco Payment Solutions
Vanco Payment Solutions focuses on meeting the unique needs of clients who count on predictable, recurring revenue. Faith-based, nonprofits and other relationship-oriented organizations—and the software providers and professional associations that serve them—rely on Vanco’s specialized approach to adding electronic payment options and enhancing current capabilities. The company's experienced leadership team helps more than 30,000 clients across the U.S. conveniently, securely and efficiently accept a broad range of payments, including credit and debit cards, and more effectively manage their operations.
